intro: Gagea omalensis, commonly known as the Omalensis spring beauty, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are basal and grass-like, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gagea omalensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
